maml:description.maml:para: Upload a signed client certificate.

Uploads a signed `THIRD_PARTY` client certificate with the `AWAITING_SIGNED_CERTIFICATE` status. See Client certificates (https://techdocs.akamai.com/mtls-origin-keystore/docs/manage-client-certificates)to learn more.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

When present, the function uploads the signed certificate ignoring all warnings. When not included in the call, the upload process is stopped and displays any warnings for you to review before proceeding.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your client certificate's name.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Your client certificate's version, either as an integer or the word `latest`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

When present, the function uploads the signed certificate ignoring all warnings. When not included in the call, the upload process is stopped and displays any warnings for you to review before proceeding.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your client certificate's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Your client certificate's version, either as an integer or the word `latest`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

When present, the function uploads the signed certificate ignoring all warnings. When not included in the call, the upload process is stopped and displays any warnings for you to review before proceeding.
The file to read the client certificate data from. It needs to be in PEM format.
Your client certificate's name.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
The file to read the trust chain data from. It needs to be in PEM format.
Your client certificate's version, either as an integer or the word `latest`.

Expand client certificate details.
It's an internal function used to retrieve MTLS Origin Keystore client certificates and their versions more easily in other commands.
Your client certificate's name.
Your client certificate's ID.
Your client certificate's version, either as an integer or the word `latest`.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Additional arguments.

Additional arguments.
Your client certificate's version, either as an integer or the word `latest`.
List account CA certificates.
Lists CA certificates under the account.
A list of statuses separated by commas used to filter account CA certificates. Only certificates matching the provided statuses are included in the results.

Get a client certificate.
Lists all client certificates, or retrieves a single entry by either its ID or name.

Create a client certificate.
Creates a client certificate with the provided name.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your client certificate's name.
The common name of the client certificate.
The contract assigned to the client certificate.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

The type of network to deploy the client certificate. Either `CORE`, `RUSSIA_AND_CORE`, or `CHINA_AND_CORE`. Use `CORE` to deploy across most of the world except for licensed areas. Use `RUSSIA_AND_CORE` to include Russia, or `CHINA_AND_CORE` to include China. Based on Chinese and Russian government approval, enable non-core deployments on your contract.
The group ID assigned to the client certificate.
The email addresses to notify about client certificate-related issues.
The common name of the account CA certificate selected to sign the client certificate. Omit if you want to add this later.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

The network deployment type. Either `STANDARD_TLS` or `ENHANCED_TLS`. A value of `ENHANCED_TLS` means Akamai's more secure network with PCI compliance capability, while `STANDARD_TLS` means Akamai's standard secure network.
The signing entity of the client certificate. Either `AKAMAI` or `THIRD_PARTY`. A value of `AKAMAI` means Akamai is the signer, while `THIRD_PARTY` means the third-party issuer is the signer.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

The contract assigned to the client certificate.

Use `RUSSIA_AND_CORE` to include Russia, or `CHINA_AND_CORE` to include China. Based on Chinese and Russian government approval, enable non-core deployments on your contract.
The group ID assigned to the client certificate.
The email addresses to notify about client certificate-related issues.
The common name of the account CA certificate selected to sign the client certificate. Omit if you want to add this later.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

The network deployment type. Either `STANDARD_TLS` or `ENHANCED_TLS`. A value of `ENHANCED_TLS` means Akamai's more secure network with PCI compliance capability, while `STANDARD_TLS` means Akamai's standard secure network.
The signing entity of the client certificate. Either `AKAMAI` or `THIRD_PARTY`. A value of `AKAMAI` means Akamai is the signer, while `THIRD_PARTY` means the third-party issuer is the signer.
Rotate a client certificate.
Creates a new version or a given client certificate, represented either by its ID or name.
